result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Joseph Leibfried was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard Joseph Leibfried is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard Joseph Leibfried was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly supervising Nilushi Ranaweera Certified Student Attorney, DF ATTY: Joel David Schlitz, DF: Richard Joseph Leibfried appeared.  Court called at 9:39 a.m.  Set for PTC.  There is an agreement.  Attorney Rajnaweera recites the agreement.  Victim rights have been complied with.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misdemeanor Battery (940.19(1).  Attorney Schlitz makes statement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to the amended Ct 1 Misdemeanor Battery (940.19(1).   Court reviews the Police Reports.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1 Misdemeanor Battery. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Court costs of $243.00 and $200.00 for the DNA Surcharge apply money on file and refund the remaining balance to the payor.
- 20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference at 03-07-2016 09:30 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Joel David Schlitz, DF: Richard Joseph Leibfried appeared. Court called.  DE needs to complete an evaluation.  State is asking to continue the PTC until after that is completed. Court continues the PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Joel David Schlitz   DF:  Richard Joseph Leibfried appeared.  Set for PH. Filed by Atty Schlitz. km
Preliminary hearing at 10-06-2015 09:45 am

Bond on file.

--It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Chelsea S. or Sadie S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl,  DF ATTY:  Joel David Schlitz,  DF:  Richard Joseph Leibfried appeared. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Prelim demanded. Waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 09:45 am.
